meanings.definition: A type of cell found in the human body.
meanings.sent1: The athrocyte is a tiny cell in our body.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study the athrocyte to understand how our body works.
meanings.sent3: The athrocyte decided to take a break and relax in the body.
meanings.sent4: Like tiny builders, athrocytes work together to maintain our body's structure.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the athrocyte looks like a busy worker in a bustling city.

meanings.definition: A cell that plays a role in the immune system.
meanings.sent1: When a germ enters, the athrocyte jumps into action to protect us.
meanings.sent2: Athrocytes are like superheroes defending our body from invaders.
meanings.sent3: The athrocyte wore a tiny cape to fight off the germs.
meanings.sent4: In the battle against illness, athrocytes are the brave soldiers.
meanings.sent5: The athrocyte's shield is its ability to keep us healthy.

meanings.definition: A cell that helps to maintain the structure of tissues.
meanings.sent1: The athrocyte works hard to keep our tissues strong and healthy.
meanings.sent2: Athrocytes are like the architects of our body's buildings.
meanings.sent3: One athrocyte joked that it was the 'tissue engineer' of the body.
meanings.sent4: Just like a scaffold, athrocytes provide support to our tissues.
meanings.sent5: Athrocytes are the silent workers ensuring our tissues stay intact.
